overview_of_class: Advanced Grammar Through French Media is designed for students who are interested in news media and journalism. The purpose of this course is to study, understand and practice grammar in context. A variety of authentic documents, from newspapers articles to radio interviews, will illustrate and enliven specific grammar points. French 301 will help students master the finer points of French Grammar while preparing them to communicate competently (in writing and orally) in informal and formal situations.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Students must have taken and passed French 202 prior, or they must obtain the consent of the instructor.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Students will review and expand their French grammar foundation.
Students will be able to develop their listening and speaking proficiency in French.
Students will be able to improve their reading and writing skills through focused exercises.
Students will be able to increase their cultural knowledge of France (history, sociocultural norms, media, popular culture).

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: This course forms part of the advanced language group - French 302: Composition, French 303: Conversation, and French 309: French in Commerce & Industry.
